intro: Trasus extensus, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Trasus extensus typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
